Reviews.Title: “Retro, but lovely”
Reviews.Author: reviewedbyk
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its amazing location and the great price. It is a little on the older side, but it is clean and the staff is friendly. The hotel even uses old fashioned keys! not key cards. I stayed her with my mom on my spring break (which was in february) and turns out it was one of the times that Venice floods!!! The waters from the sea were about 20ft from the doors of the hotel! (But this is not unusual so fear not) It was quite exciting and the city puts up cat walks where the flooding is so it is still easy to get around when the tide is high. There is also a FABULOUS little trattoria called "Conca d'Oro" just up the alley from the hotel where my mom and I had the best pizza in all out our Italian vacation. The hotel serves a free continental breakfast as well and my mom loved the coffee so much she had to have her fix every morning. To this day whenever she finds a good cup, she sighs and says "Venice."

Reviews.Title: “240 Steps to the Doge's Palace”
Reviews.Author: RodAlix
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location. The Hotel Commercio & Pellegrino is near the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop & only 100 steps from Gondole Danieli (prominently shown in Depp's & Jolie's movie, "The Tourist". The Doge's Palace public entrance is 240 steps from the front door of the Hotel C&P, 404 steps to the Bell Tower/Campanile & 465 steps to St. Mark's Cathedral entrance. This is great if you are touring St. Mark's Plaza & want to return to your room for a break or go for an evening walk when the crowds have thinned out. Our room was adequate, neat & clean. We stayed at the Hotel C&P for 3 nights. It was expensive, but we were willing to pay for its central location. If you can live without bacon, eggs, biscuits & gravy for breakfast, you will find the crescent rolls, yogurt, muesli, cold cuts, cheese, juice, coffee, tea...at the Hotel C&P more than satisfactory to start your day. The poorest & most expensive meal we had was at a restaurant recommended by a Hotel C&P desk clerk. The best meals we had were at a restaurant in the Arsenale neighborhood about 3/4 of a mile from the hotel. Stroll along the broad cement walk or get off at the Arsenale vaporetto stop. Look for a wide street lined with restaurants--we ate the 4th or 5th one in on the left. Its tourist menus had very good food at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Just Round The Corner From St. Mark`s Square.”
Reviews.Author: happyjack51
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is tucked away in a narrow street just to the right (as you get off the vaporetto) of St. Mark`s Square. It can be reached from the waterfront or via St. Mark`s Square. It is a small hotel not a large lavish `cost a packet` job but perfectly adequate and well placed. Quite a few people were there overnighting before joining their cruise ships. The staff speak perfect English and are very helpful. They suggested where to eat (and told us where NOT to eat as there are many places that will not give good value for money) and the restaurant they sent us to had good food, wine, surroundings and was not too expensive(for Venice!) You do have to be prepared to pay more for everything there so just choose within your price range from the menu. Bedrooms in the hotel were very clean and comfortable, quite spacious with good beds, air conditioning and en suite. There was a lift but you had to walk up the stairs to the top floor where we were.(Not a problem).We slept well and it was quiet despite there being many guests. Breakfast was on par for Italy, coffee,tea, some cereals, rolls, ham and cheese and when I sent my husband down to get me a cup of tea before getting up (yes, in bed!) they gave him a tray with a lovely pot of tea, cup and saucer.(As normal in Med countries no tea/coffee facilities in the room so take your own if you want it.) All the staff were friendly and helpful and we thought the price was very reasonable for where it was. We were very central. Also the little bar at the end of the street was brilliant with very locals prices. Handy tip - Don`t sit down for drinks or they put an extra euro on each drink. We loved our stay and the hotel and found good places to eat and drink within our budget. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: karlab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend 3 nights at the Hotel Commercio & Pellegrino, and we really enjoyed it. The location is amazing. Just steps from the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop (which you can take to and from the airport) and steps from St. Mark's, Doge's Palace, and a bunch of places to eat. The room was small, but most hotel rooms in Italy are small! It was neat, clean and quiet. The bed and pillows were hard, but we found this in all of the hotels we stayed in. We were so tired at the end of every night, so we both slept fine. The people at the front desk were very friendly and always willing to help us out with directions and restaurant recommendations. There was a strike the day we left for Florence, and the man at the front desk told us about the strike, and gave us an alternative route to the train station. Breakfast was basic (it was actually the same food that was served at the two other hotels we stayed at in Italy) but it was fine for a nice, light breakfast. I had no problems eating a croissant for breakfast every morning! All in all, I would recommend this hotel to someone who is looking for a basic, no frills, yet clean and well located hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Location”
Reviews.Author: MarciaKH
Reviews.Content: Around the corner from the Bridge of Sighs, Doge Palace, and San Marco (St. Mark's Square) this is a perfect location for the first time tourist. It's also on a small but lively street, and close to restaurants including the best sandwich place, in the world, Birreria Forst right next door! Try the porcetta with special sauce. You won't regret it! Staff was helpful and the room was clean and comfortable enough with windows overlooking the busy street below. Breakfast is good, with pitchers of coffee and milk brought to the tables. If you must take an early flight, it is only steps from this hotel (and then left) to the San Zaccaria Waterbus which begins around 3:50 am and goes to the airport in about 1 hour 20 minutes, then an easy 17 minute walk around the building to the airport entrance. A relief that it was so easy. I found this hotel through EuropeanDestinations.com, was very reasonably priced, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING LOCATION!! Would stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: cruzin4436
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel and we really enjoyed it. The rooms were clean and nice and the bathroom was very nice. The breakfast was great and had exactly what we needed. The location is the big seller on this place it is literally steps from San Marcâ€™s Square and the Dogeâ€™s Palace.. We never needed to take a big bag of our stuff- if we needed something or if we were tired we would just pop back over to the hotel because it was so close to all the action. Also according to Rick Steveâ€™s you are in the heart of the sandwich district and there are plenty of great places to get a sandwich on the go. The staff at the hotel were very nice and helpful. If there is anything negative that I can say about this place itâ€™s the bed situation a double is really 2 twin beds pushed together (not exactly ideal for a romantic getaway) as we continued our travels through Italy however we learned that this bedroom arrangement was pretty common. Overall the price and the location are just right and I would be happy to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: GazBouch
Reviews.Content: Perfect location less than 5 minutes from St Marks square & the Grand Canal, but sound proof windows so no noise from the crowds.First impressions is it looks like its down a dark alley, but all the side streets look like that. Rooms are clean, and housekeeping is spot on. Breakfast was good, meat, cheese, rolls, jams, juice, fruit, cereal, endless coffee, hot chocolate etc. the waitresses were friendly and attentive. Reception staff were helpful, tv didnt work on arrival, but it just needed tuning. Would we stay here again - yes, without a doubt. I've stayed in 3 and 4 star hotels all over the world and this is a good 3 star for Venice. Okay the grout in the bathroom was not pure white, and the view from the window was nothing special, but this is Venice, which is about getting out and seeing the architecture, so the room is less important, but in this hotel it was more than satisfactory. Location is worth an extra star, you can get from the waterbus to your room in less than 10 minutes. Dont eat at the restaurants nearby, they are grossly overpriced and the food and service is a disgrace on Italy. Walk 15 minutes to Arsenale area, away from the crowds, cheaper and better value bars & restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: ezsfish
Reviews.Content: Great location (less than 2 minutes from St. Marks Square. Rooms were nice and comfortable. Shower is typically small like most in europe. Valentina and her staff were quite helpful. Breakfast was usually ready by 7:15. Would definitely stay again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “simple, clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: popiel52
Reviews.Content: small room, but had all one needed. Internet was very expensive (9 euro per hour) and breakfast, barely ok.. It was clean, but the beds were hard as a rock, good thing we wore ourselves battling the Venitian crowds.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel and amazing location”
Reviews.Author: mrs_random
Reviews.Content: this hotel doesnt look much on the outside but on the inside is lovely. nice sized rooms, modern bathroom with power shower, walk in wardrobe, flat screen tv, friendly staff and most of all the most fantastic location. please ignore any bad reviews made because in my opinion it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but loud at night”
Reviews.Author: DontwaitMn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location and easy to find. I can imaging many of the other hotels in Venice would be hard as it is easy to get lost down all the streets. This hotel was only a short walk from the docks. The rooms were nothing special as are most of the rooms in venice. Many nights there were people talking in the streets and I did have trouble sleeping becaus of this. There were a couple restaurants just outside and it started to quiet down around 12-1AM.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: GoProvidence
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great, easy location and is a great value. If your travel group includes people who can't do too much walking, you should consider this hotel. ( There is an elevator.) The hotel is comfortable. The rooms are decent sized, clean and quiet (but not pretty.) The breakfast was satisfactory and plentiful. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It's not a glamorous hotel but for two nights it served our purposes very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AthensSoloist
Reviews.Content: The reasonable price of 95 euros/night and the location of the Commercio & Pelegrino hotel -3 minutes away from Piazza San Marco and just steps away from the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop- were the main reasons we chose to stay there. However, we were first given a room (no 403) which was unbelievably small. (I bet it was originally a single room). The window was next to something like a chimney and the temperature of the room was so high (27C!!!) that we had to sleep with the window open (outside temperature at night was below 10C). Next day, we were moved to another room (no 404) of reasonable size. Bathrooms in both rooms were OK. Hairdryer is of the old type (hose) and takes ages to dry your hair, so it's a good idea to bring yours... The buffet breakfast is poor and depressing. The free afternoon tea &cookies is nothing special, and certainly not something you should alter you plans for. Overall, if you are looking for a no-frills place, very conveniently located, you may consider this. The price we paid was good for Venice standards, but it was completely off season. In the high season, when price is doubled, you may consider staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: DocGJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my girlfriend and both of our parents last year. This is a fine hotel not amazing - friendly staff clean rooms, nice touch that they do free afternoon drinks and biscuits (although this is at a rather annoying time of day to get back to you're hotel if you're out and about exploring Venice). It was a bit noisey in the morning from the street (the Hotel Danielli, which is a stones through away, was having some work done) and we had two twin beds pushed together for our double room, but the key is the price and the location seriously elevates this hotel above the rest. Why would you pay more to stay in Venice (which costs enough already) when you can base yourself here - right by the Straw Bridge and San Marco's with a vaporetta stop 5mins away. The old Greek quarter is with in easy walking distant and also lovely. SOme great restaurants just round the corner too

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: anamaria1884
Reviews.Content: We practically "lived" there for one week because is close to everything. If you need to ho inside for a brake, if you need to rest, if you need information, the hotel is there. Also very very clean, the employers are very kind and the atmosphere is so familiar. If you want to visit Venice and to enjoy a great accommodation just go at Commercio & Pellegrino Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location very close to the San Marco Square”
Reviews.Author: Patrikbzz
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location, 3 min walk to the San Marco square. The rooms are nice and clean, but no real views to talk about. Service was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be worthy of 4 star rating Our rooms (2) were rather smallish but not to the point of being too uncomfortable. All the rest was above expectations. Excellent location, very clean, good air-con., well equipped bathroom, very nice firm mattresses. Rooms looked recently done up. Courteous staff, breakfast OK

Reviews.Title: “Served its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: AngDc
Reviews.Content: Room was cramped and stuffy, cheesy decor, staff not fantastically helpful, but it was close to St. Mark's and served its purpose just fine. It is on a loud street with some nightlife, so pack earplugs or go elsewhere. Compared to our great deal in Rome (Santa Costanza), we felt it was a step down, but overall it worked.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks”
Reviews.Author: Aldur
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights i May based on your reviews here. So first of all thanks for your reviews. They turned out to be true. The hotel was great considering the price, the location can't be better, fair size rooms, twin beds (unusual in Venice), nice bathroom, good air con, fair breakfast, nice and helpful staff, so all in all great value fore money. Quiet side street with nice sandwich bars. As somebody pointed out, only negative is the horrendous restaurant prices around San Marco, 10 min walk towards the Arsenal reduces the prices substantially though (and improves the food). It's not easy to find good hotels at a reasonable prices in Venice, this is one, and with a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WestonJohn
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully situated for transport, 5 mins from vaporetto, 5 mins from St Marks Sqauare, Bars restraunts etc, very close, very quiet, great decor, excellent service. Ideal location to see the carnival goings on. Staff very helpful, breakfast good, even served afernoon tea. Great ! Super ! would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “If you're a U.S. or Canadian citizen, you might get a discount!”
Reviews.Author: MN_SF
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in July of 2008, and was thankful for the air conditioning! The room was quiet, clean and spacious. One plus for me: the hotels' website was offering a discount to U.S. and Canadian citizens if you paid the rates in USD cash! Check the hotel's site to see if that deal is still valid. The location was great, and I'd stay there again in a second. It's less than a 5-minute walk to the Bridge of Sighs and to St. Mark's!

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bumbletraveller
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews we decided to book this hotel as it was great value but still in an excellent location. The hotel did not disappoint - you are so close to everything here. The staff were helpful, the room was clean and a good size. There was plenty of choice at breakfast and they were constantly bringing out more fresh rolls and cold meats etc (unlike other hotels where we found if you weren't really early you had whatever was left). The only disadvantage of being here was that it was so central a lot of the restaurants close by were expensive for very average food. You come to Venice expecting to pay more, but we were on a budget and did have to walk a way to find somewhere that didn't break the bank. We didn't mind this, it was lovely walking around Venice at night and away from the millions of people in St Mark's Square, but not everyone might see it this way.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ateva
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a couple of hundred metres from St Marks Square near San Zaccharia water bus stop. This is a lovely little hotel with nice staff, in particular Miko at reception. He runs a two hour walking tour of Venice in his own time and is well worth taking if you are a first timer in Venice. Our room was of a reasonable size, airconditioned and clean. The room overlooked Calle delle Rasse and it was great to see people going about their business on the street below. The only downside was the basic breakfast, but as was pointed out to me, you don't come to Venice for it's breakfast. The hotel has plenty of charm and the area plenty of atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tea13f
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything we were looking for in venice! The location was excellant! right around the corner from St Marks Square. Getting to the hotel was a breeze even with our huge suitcases and over the bridges and all. The hotel staff were great and very helpful. Room was clean and tidy and great for the price we paid. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: greve
Reviews.Content: Location could not be beaten. Easy to get to from watertaxi from both the airport and the station. Room small but well appointed, breakfast good, staff helpful. Our son and his family also joined us and asked for, and were given, a room suitable for a baby. They were very happy with the result. Easy to get around, and the hotel being so close to St Marks Square, convenient to pop back for a rest from the heat and the crowds. Small cafe at the end of the lane, on the right, is really good value for a glass of wine and a time spent 'gondolier watching'. This is where they come after their shifts. We were the only tourists there, and the mood and staff were fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mimi11197
Reviews.Content: My first reaction to this place was great location. My inital experience with the front desk was not great but once that guy (who did not want to be there) was switched out it got better. As a quick plug go visit Bar Verde at the end of the road. They are open with great hours so when the rest of venice was in bed we were at Bar Verde. Back to the hotel the room was nice, beds were comfy. The hot water did not always last very long but overall we were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Quaint Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: uhcoogdebi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights prior to a cruise. The hotel was easy to reach by public transportation. The hotel is near the Zaccaria motor-boat station. Even though the room was small, we had a view of the canal from the street. The shower was quite adequate. The buffet breakfast that is served daily downstairs was average. The hot chocolate was exceptional. The staff was friendly, but lacked major knowledge of the english language. The location can't be beat! Near the Piazza San Marco and there are many places to eat along the street. I would definitely stay here again just because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel w/ the perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: poopydoopy
Reviews.Content: We arrived by train and taking the water bus to the hotel was extremely easy. The bus stop was only a minute away and there's no need to cross any bridges! The airport water bus is also very close, only 1 bridge to cross. I've heard stories of people carrying their bags up/down, bridge after bridge, I'm so glad we didn't have to endure that! And, it's right around the corner from St Mark's Sq so it was the perfect location! The room was very basic and small but that's to be expected in europe. More importantly, it was clean and the staff were nice and helpful. Contintental breakfast served daily in the lobby. Either they baked their own bread or there's a bakery near by...but we woke up to the wonderful smell of fresh bread baking in the oven...it was incredible!!!

Reviews.Title: “We can't fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelqueenDeal
Reviews.Content: What a gem! Like gems, not cheap at Â£100 per night (this is Venice after all) but worth every penny. Unbeatable location at the bottom end of C de Rasse, next to the Danieli hotel at 6 times the price, this 3* is unbeatable. Spotlessly clean and efficiently run (we had a nose in the kitchen too), simple and ample breakfast, very helpful reception staff (I can't believe the reviews that say otherwise) and cracking location. only yards from the San Zaccaria waterbus stop (off the jetty, turn left over one bridge and 20 yards up to your right) where the Alilaguna airport transport bus stops as well as ACTV waterbuses for .. well, everywhere! Just 2 minutes at a slow wander to St Mark's Square with good quality and good value restaurants in the same street - wonderful stuffed toasted sandwiches at the top of C de Rasse on the right - if you can get in for gondoliers etc on their break. 2 enormous sandwiches and cappucinos that kept us going for 7 hours for 14 euros (Â£5 each at our rotten exchange rate 26 March 2008). I would not hesitate to stay here again.... unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: liljro
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of our pit-stops from our Adventurous Honeymoon. The place is in a great location close to St. Mark's Square the rooms were very clean and the staff was very helpful. The showers are small but that's all of Italy. The hotel provides continental breakfast which includes: cheeses, cereal, coffee, ham & danishes and saved us from spending outside. Would definately recommend this hotel for travelers. Venice, Italy is definately a beautiful city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.....”
Reviews.Author: AudnAde
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with a group of friends & neighbours, chance booking by one of the group. On the 3rd floor, rooms very clean and more than big enough, staff very friendly; breakfast = not a lot of choice, but eat as much as you want; but the location was FANTASTIC ! just a few minutes walk from St Mark's, close to the vaporetto stops on the Grand Canal, and close to some fantastic bars and restaurants down little back streets & off the main tourist drag (especially liked Ristorante Al Giardine, Via Castello 4928, takes some finding & you may have to book, but worth every bit of the effort); all in all superb value for money, & certaily worth a revisit
